properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: 25 to 40 mm of rain has fallen over a broad swath of the BC Interior since early Wednesday morning. Some higher elevation stations in the South Cariboo received 50 to 70 mm of rain in that time period. Radar shows an area of showers persisting over Prince George, Williston and McGregor late this afternoon. The showers will continue this evening and isolated thunderstorms will also develop early this evening. Brief, heavy downpours from thunderstorms could produce another 5 to 15 mm of rainfall for these regions through tonight. Please refer to the BC River Forecast Centre web page for the latest flood warnings and advisories: http://bcrfc.env.gov.bc.ca/warnings/index.htm ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-03T06:31:32-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-03T01:09:32-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1012921279.2020
Area: Williston, Prince George, McGregor
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 9:18 p.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a line of dangerous thunderstorms capable of producing damaging wind gusts, nickel to ping pong ball size hail and heavy rain. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-07-03T03:49:39-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-03T02:18:39-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0864498425.2020

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms this evening. Primary threats from these thunderstorms include wind gusts up to 100 km/h and hail size up to quarter size. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2020-07-03T04:29:22-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-03T00:24:22-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3996970975.2020
Area: Greater Sudbury and vicinity, Elliot Lake - Ranger Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts and large hail. With an approaching upper disturbance and recent heat and moisture in the watch area, conditions are allowing for the development of severe thunderstorms this evening and evening in northern SK and western/southern MB. This watch area will likely be extended as the situation develops this evening and overnight. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Locally heavy rain is also possible. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-03T07:32:04-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-03T00:34:04-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1229669964.2020

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 7:54 p.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a dangerous thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to golf ball size hail and heavy rain. This thunderstorm is over of Cedar Lake and traveling northeast at 30 km/h. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Very large hail can damage property, break windows, dent vehicles and cause serious injury. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.

properties.Summary:
Description: At 8:34 p.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a line of severe thunderstorms capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This line of severe thunderstorms is located from 11 kilometres west of Mozhabong Lake to 7 kilometres northeast of Quirke Lake, moving southeast at 65 km/h. Winds gusts up to 100 km/h will be possible with these storms. Locations impacted include: River Aux Sables Provincial Park, Rushbrook Provincial Park, Whiskey Lake and Lac aux Sables. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 8:53 p.m. EDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a line of severe thunderstorms capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This line of severe thunderstorms is located from Manitouwadge to 9 kilometres north of Pringle, moving southeast at 50 km/h. Locations impacted include: White Lake Provincial Park, Amwri, Trudeau, Ravine Lake, Mobert, White Lake, Shabotik Bay and Clay Bay. ###
